function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inaccurate risk assessment and detection platform","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate tracking of covid-19 patient presence","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Displaying covid-19 spread information without real-time updates could lead to misinformation and outdated data.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Testing the application with a small number of respondents may not represent the diversity of user experiences and needs.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of sqlite database to store covid-19 data","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Using web scraping to retrieve covid-19 data from external sources can lead to inaccurate or outdated information.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on a single website for covid-19 data retrieval increases the risk of system failure if the website is down or inaccessible.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential security risks when scraping data from external websites, including exposure to malicious code or unauthorized access to sensitive data.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of human expert oversight in the decision-making process based on the expert system’s recommendations may lead to errors and adverse consequences in covid-19 management.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Implementation of a website-based expert system for covid-19 diagnosis","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Diagnosis of covid-19 using ct image features","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Mobile application for covid-19 symptom diagnosis","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on web scraping for covid-19 information","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Recommend building measures not implemented correctly","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of focus on airborne transmission reduction in hospitals and public buildings","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation leading to airborne transmission of sars-cov-2 virus","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of engineering controls in reducing airborne infection risks","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate maintenance of air cleaners leading to reduced filtration efficiency","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Risk of person-to-person transmission in indoor environments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of clear guidelines for safe occupancy numbers in indoor spaces","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Risk of airborne transmission in public transportation systems","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential ineffectiveness of upper-room guv in killing or inactivating airborne microorganisms due to inadequate uv fluence rate or non-uniform uvgi distribution","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Variation in performance of portable consumer air cleaning devices depending on design and room size","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential ineffectiveness of guv ’in-duct’ application in disinfecting contaminated extracts or ventilation ducts","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased humidity can decrease the inactivation of bacterial and viral aerosols, potentially leading to higher transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of data on the effectiveness of uv-c inactivating sars-cov-2, which may lead to uncertainty in the selection of appropriate control measures for the virus.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Recirculation of air in the built environment during an epidemic, including covid-19, can lead to the dissemination of virus-laden particles.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Air cleaning and disinfection devices may be beneficial in environments with poor ventilation.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of filters in removing small particles associated with adverse health effects","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Modification of hvac control strategies may not be straightforward and could lead to unintended consequences for temperature, humidity, and air flow distribution.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Customization of ventilation systems can introduce new design vulnerabilities and potential failure points, increasing the risk of airborne disease transmission.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dependence on natural ventilation methods may result in inconsistent and unreliable outdoor air flow rates, leading to varying levels of ventilation effectiveness.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation in public buildings and shared spaces","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Survival of airborne pathogens in indoor environments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Returning to inadequately ventilated workplaces and public buildings","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Local barriers to ventilation due to partitions or drawn curtains","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limitations in increasing ventilation rates during the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation leading to high concentration of virus-laden air","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of recognition of ventilation as a critical method for reducing airborne transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in quantitatively comparing and concluding the most significant transmission route for viruses in a given situation.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of recommendations and engineering controls to reduce the potential airborne transmission of sars-cov-2 and other airborne viruses.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Airborne transmission of contagious diseases such as tuberculosis, measles, chickenpox, sars-cov, mers-cov, rsv, and influenza.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Viral loads found in personal samplers worn by the sampling team when in the presence of a patient receiving oxygen via nasal cannula, indicating potential airborne transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of direct confirmatory evidence of self-inoculation into mucous membranes as the end-stage pathway to infection through droplet and contact transmission routes.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Incongruity in the level of evidence required to demonstrate airborne transmission compared to other transmission modes.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential airborne transmission of sars-cov-2","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of preparedness for unexpected major disruptions in the supply chain","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Gaps in academic literature related to collaboration, technology adoption, and knowledge creation in supply chain management","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited scope of literature search due to use of only one database scopus .","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Exploratory studies may not identify all potential drivers of contagious diseases in the built environment.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"}]}
